title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Latter Day Saints
creator: Emma Smith
subject: Emma Smith; Kirtland; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: The first hymnal compiled for the Mormon church. Although the book was printed in 1836, it is still referred to as the "1835 hymnal" because of the publication date on the title page. This hymnal was in response to Doctrine & Covenants 25 wherein Emma Smith was directed to compile a hymnal for the new church. This pocket-size hymnbook was not published until 5 years after the revelation, as there were many difficult circumstances surrounding the church such as the destruction of the Independence printing press by a mob. The hymnbook has only words and no tunes. Most of the hymns were from the Baptists or Campbellites’ hymnals.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Christ of the Latter Day Saints
creator: Benjamin C. Elsworth
subject: Unofficial; Words Only
collection: L. Tom Perry Special Collections
description: Benjamin Elsworth reported in October 1840, that he had been laboring as a missionary in Oswego County, New York, and it is likely he published his hymnal in that area. Elsworth’s hymnal is based mostly on the 1835 Kirtland hymnal and the 1838 David Rogers hymnal.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Brigham Young; Europe; Words Only
collection: Church History Library
description: A hymnal published for the use of the British Saints. Brigham Young, Parley Pratt, and John Taylor were designated to pick the hymns and oversee the printing. At least 36 of the hymns were written by Parley P. Pratt.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints
creator: Emma Smith
subject: Emma Smith; Nauvoo; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: The 1835 hymnal was out of print, and by October 1839 the general conference in Nauvoo voted to publish a new edition of the hymns immediately. This hymnbook is an expanded version of the 1835 hymnal, going from 90 to 301 hymns, still in words-only format. Many of the added hymns were focused on grace and the atonement of Jesus Christ. Seventy-seven of the hymns are in the 1835 Kirtland hymnal, 78 hymns are from the 1840 Manchester hymnal, five more are from the 1839 Elsworth hymnal. Only ten hymns were written by church members.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: HathiTrust digital version from the original at Duke University Libraries
description: The first edition of the Manchester hymnal sold quickly, and thus was needed another printing of the hymnal for the ever growing number of members in Great Britain.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the use of the Latter Day Saints
creator: John E. Page; John Cairns
publisher: John E. Page and John Cairns
subject: Missionary Hymnal; Unofficial; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: Two elders of the church, John Page and John Cairns, compiled this hymnbook as there was an urgent demand for more hymnbooks. The publication date is uncertain, but it is before the Nauvoo 1841 hymnal, as the preface notes “there is a large collection about to be published at Nauvoo, Ill.”

title: A small selection of choice hymns for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints
creator: C. Merkley
subject: Unofficial; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: Little is known of the circumstances of this hymnal. May have been for personal use. Christopher Merkeley was at home recovering from ague in Nauvoo in 1840, and then went with his family to a mission in Canada in June 1841, according to his autobiography.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: L. Tom Perry Special Collections
description: This third edition was printed due to high demand of the hymnal, as the second edition sold out quickly. This was also the edition where the printing was moved from Manchester to Liverpool.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the use of the Latter Day Saints
creator: Jesse Carter Little; George Bryant Gardner
subject: Unofficial; Musical Notation
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: This is the first LDS hymnbook with musical notations. Little and Gardner both lived in Peterborough, New Hampshire. They likely collaborated together, as Little was a merchant and Gardner a musician, to publish the hymnbook for the Peterborough’s congregation.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: L. Tom Perry Special Collections
description: This edition was printed in a larger run, and wasn’t sold as rapidly as the other Manchester hymnals. Changes are only a few spelling changes and a different numbering of the songs from the third edition.

title: Collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints
creator: Charles A. Adams
subject: Unofficial; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: Charles A Adams, a music teacher, created this hymnal and may contain some of his own compositions, as four hymns are not in any other LDS hymnbook. The preface is taken from the 1835 Kirtland hymnal.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Duke University Libraries
description: This Manchester hymnal edition added 16 additional songs.

title: A collection of sacred hymns, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe
creator: Brigham Young; Parley P. Pratt; John Taylor
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Church History Library
description: This eighth edition has no alterations or additions from the seventh edition. Printed due to high demand.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive
description: This edition was the first to use a metrical index, for the use of choirs. The Psalmody published in the United States the same year had some emphasis on choral music and the publisher notes this connection. This edition also included some additional sacramental and funeral hymns.

title: The Latter-Day Saints' psalmody. A collection of original tunes
creator: George Careless; Ebenezer Beesley; Joseph J. Daynes; Evan Stephens; Thomas C. Griggs
subject: Musical Notation;
collection: Church History Library
description: This was the first official to include musical settings with the texts, it also included many choir hymns. Many Latter-day Saint hymns that had been previously published in magazines were collected in this hymnal. Each hymn in this hymnal was cross-referenced by page number to the Manchester Hymnal.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive, from Princeton Theological Seminary Library
description: This twentieth edition notes the influence of the Latter-day Saint's Psalmody hymnal for continuing demand. This edition also includes 17 additonal hymns.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: This edition includes one additional hymn than the twentieth edition.

title: The Latter-Day Saints' psalmody. A collection of original tunes
creator: George Careless; Ebenezer Beesley; Joseph J. Daynes; Evan Stephens; Thomas C. Griggs
subject: Musical Notation;
collection: Google Books, from the New York Public Library
description: Has an additional 24 hymns in this second edition.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Google Books, from Princeton University Library
description: This edition contains the same amount of hymns as the previous 21st edition.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: Each hymn has a designated number of the tune corresponding to the Latter-Day Saints' Psalmody.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at the Church History Library
description: Fourteen hymns have been added to this edition, many of them funeral hymns. The names of the authors have been appended.

title: The Latter-Day Saints' psalmody. A collection of original and selected tunes
creator: George Careless; Ebenezer Beesley; Joseph J. Daynes; Evan Stephens; Thomas C. Griggs
subject: Musical Notation;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Brigham Young University Library
description: Due to popular demand this fourth edition was printed, but is essentially the same as the third edition.

title: The Songs of Zion. A collection of choice songs
creator: German E. Ellsworth
publisher: Missions for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Missionary Hymnal;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Harvard University
description: German Ellsworth compiled this hymnbook by surveying nine LDS Church mission presidents of their favorite hymns. The purpose of this hymnbook was to simplify and reduce the cost of multiple hymnbooks, as at the time there were the Manchester Hymnal, the Latter-day Saints’ Psalmody, and the Deseret Sunday School Union Songbook. The front cover has the silhouette of the Tabernacle Organ.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Google Books, from Princeton University Library
description: This is the final edition of the Manchester hymnal, and has an additional 2 hymns.

title: The Latter-Day Saints' psalmody. A collection of original and selected tunes
creator: George Careless; Ebenezer Beesley; Joseph J. Daynes; Evan Stephens; Thomas C. Griggs
subject: Musical Notation;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Brigham Young University Library
description: Due to popular demand this fifth edition was printed, but is essentially the same as the third and fourth edition.

title: The Songs of Zion. A collection of choice songs
creator: German E. Ellsworth
publisher: Missions for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Missionary hymnal;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Harvard University
description: This second edition contains an additional 23 hymns.

title: The Songs of Zion. A collection of choice songs
creator: Joseph F. Smith
publisher: Missions for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
subject: Missionary hymnal;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Brigham Young University Library
description: The third edition is essentially the same as the second edition.

title: Latter-Day Saints congregational hymns
creator: Henry E. Giles
subject: Unofficial; Musical Notation
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Brigham Young University Library
description: Previously an organist for the Salt Lake Tabernacle, Henry Giles collected and published these hymns to "be sung by congregations generally without difficulty" as mentioned in the preface.

title: The Latter-Day Saints' psalmody. A collection of original and selected tunes
creator: George Careless; Ebenezer Beesley; Joseph J. Daynes; Evan Stephens; Thomas C. Griggs
subject: Musical Notation;
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Church History Library
description: Due to popular demand this seventh edition was printed, but is essentially the same as the third, fourth, fifth, and sixth edition.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, in Europe.
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Google Books, from The British Library
description: This edition includes a large change in selection of the hymns. Seventy-six new hymns were included, 60 of which were substituted from the previous edition. Adds measures and stanzas to the hymns. Also includes an index of subjects.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Church History Library
description: Twenty-six hymns have been added to this edition, as the editor notes that "the knowledge and faith of the Church have greatly increased, through the revelation of more advanced doctrines of the Gospel."

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Church History Library
description: This edition exchanges 44 of the hymns from the previous edition to be replaced with hymns composed by Latter-day Saint authors.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Church History Library
description: No changes made from the previous edition.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.
creator: George Q. Cannon
subject: Manchester; Europe; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive, from Princeton Theological Seminary Library
description: This was the first Manchester hymnal published in Utah Territory, and has 14 additional hymns.

title: Sacred hymns and spiritual songs, for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.
subject: Manchester; Words Only
collection: Internet Archive digital version from the original at Church History Library
description: This hymnal does not include a preface from the publisher, and does not have any additional hymns.

title: A collection of sacred hymns; adapted to the faith and views of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints
creator: John Hardy
subject: Words Only; Unofficial
collection: L. Tom Perry Special Collections
description: John Hardy presided over the Boston congregation from February 1843 to October 1844. This hymnal was created to meet the members' need of hymnals. The collection includes hymns from the 1841 Nauvoo hymnal, the 1835 Kirtland hymnal, and from the 1840 Manchester hymnal. Additional hymns are also composed from Mormon authors, and maybe even some written by Hardy who was known to have composed hymns.
